subject: Add tests to cover flavors
messages:
[{'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-28 16:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-28 17:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-29 05:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is failing for patrole-plugin-member, with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/patrole/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py", line 242, in wrapper
    raise rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException(msg)
patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException: Unauthorized action was allowed to be performed
Details: OverPermission: Role member was allowed to perform the following disallowed actions: ['create_flavor']

Looks like yet another issue with Neutron policy enforcement, as far as I can tell.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-31 21:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> This is failing for patrole-plugin-member, with:
 > 
 > Traceback (most recent call last):
 > File "/opt/stack/patrole/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py",
 > line 242, in wrapper
 > raise rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException(msg)
 > patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException:
 > Unauthorized action was allowed to be performed
 > Details: OverPermission: Role member was allowed to perform the
 > following disallowed actions: ['create_flavor']
 > 
 > Looks like yet another issue with Neutron policy enforcement, as
 > far as I can tell.

Quick update. For some reason, is_admin is always True. So it just skips enforcer:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/policy.py#L399

Still looking.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-31 21:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > This is failing for patrole-plugin-member, with:
 > >
 > > Traceback (most recent call last):
 > > File "/opt/stack/patrole/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py",
 > > line 242, in wrapper
 > > raise rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException(msg)
 > > patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException:
 > > Unauthorized action was allowed to be performed
 > > Details: OverPermission: Role member was allowed to perform the
 > > following disallowed actions: ['create_flavor']
 > >
 > > Looks like yet another issue with Neutron policy enforcement, as
 > > far as I can tell.
 > 
 > Quick update. For some reason, is_admin is always True. So it just
 > skips enforcer:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/policy.py#L399
 > 
 > Still looking.

Hey Mykola, that's not a Patrole issue or an issue with your patch set. This is a rather "obscure" policy that isn't good as you suggest. It is defined here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/18e941a40290100746a0a28b4a7f7308f289de90/etc/policy.json#L2

Basically, if context_is_admin is True (which it is, since we test with role:admin) then this means that context.is_admin is True (it's set somewhere in oslo.context). 

This is probably kept around for backwards compatibility though Keystone already issues a warning for it: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/authorization.py#n140

So there's really nothing we can do Patrole side. We will simply have to wait until projects drop support for context.is_admin.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-31 23:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > > This is failing for patrole-plugin-member, with:
 > > >
 > > > Traceback (most recent call last):
 > > > File "/opt/stack/patrole/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py",
 > > > line 242, in wrapper
 > > > raise rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException(msg)
 > > > patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_exceptions.RbacOverPermissionException:
 > > > Unauthorized action was allowed to be performed
 > > > Details: OverPermission: Role member was allowed to perform the
 > > > following disallowed actions: ['create_flavor']
 > > >
 > > > Looks like yet another issue with Neutron policy enforcement,
 > as
 > > > far as I can tell.
 > >
 > > Quick update. For some reason, is_admin is always True. So it
 > just
 > > skips enforcer:
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/policy.py#L399
 > >
 > > Still looking.
 > 
 > Hey Mykola, that's not a Patrole issue or an issue with your patch
 > set. This is a rather "obscure" policy that isn't good as you
 > suggest. It is defined here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/18e941a40290100746a0a28b4a7f7308f289de90/etc/policy.json#L2
 > 
 > Basically, if context_is_admin is True (which it is, since we test
 > with role:admin) then this means that context.is_admin is True
 > (it's set somewhere in oslo.context).
 > 
 > This is probably kept around for backwards compatibility though
 > Keystone already issues a warning for it: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/authorization.py#n140
 > 
 > So there's really nothing we can do Patrole side. We will simply
 > have to wait until projects drop support for context.is_admin.

In fact, that should also be noted via documentation in Patrole, as well.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-04 01:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-06 16:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-06 21:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-07 21:25:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-08 00:18:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-08 03:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-08 15:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

rechek'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-09 02:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-09 21:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Thanks LGTM'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add tests to cover flavors

This patch set adds tests to cver the flavors API [0].
Test lists, gets, creates, updates, and deletes flavors.
Part of "Increase Neutron RBAC Coverage" initiative [1]

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#networking-flavors-framework-v2-0-current-flavor-service-profile
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002641

Story: 2002641
Task: 22316

subject: Add ansible-role-tempest project under tripleo
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tempest_ansible to tempest-ansible'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

To follow other TripleO roles, I think we should name it ansible-role-tripleo-tempest. Isn't?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:07:25.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tempest-ansible to project-update'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-08 07:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-08-08 13:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-08 15:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

Yes, the plan is to make it generic enough for all users. The work will be done in two steps:
In first go, we are targeting for tripleo user then for other community projects or general users.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-08-08 16:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

k'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-08 16:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-08-08 17:32:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Could we not combine efforts and leverage the OpenStack Ansible role that already exists for doing this very type of thing?

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/

I'd love that we work together on that rather than having two Ansible tempest runners."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-08-08 18:13:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

mnaser does make a good point. It's probably better to try and update the ansible-role-os_tempest bits with what we could use in tripleo rather than forklift the oooq-extras bits into a new repo,"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-09 07:24:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> mnaser does make a good point. It's probably better to try and
 > update the ansible-role-os_tempest bits with what we could use in
 > tripleo rather than forklift the oooq-extras bits into a new repo,

Thank you mnaser and Alex for the comment, I have looked at the ansible-role-os_tempest and as well as kolla-ansible tempest role.
ansible-role-os_tempest has coverage for installing and running tempest from venv and it is branched for each release. Kolla-ansible tempest role has support for running tempest from container.
Apart from that, In tripleo-quickstart-extras project, validate-tempest role has support for Installing/configuring/running tempest from venv, rpm package as well as container as currently consumed in Tripleo-CI and support multiple releases starting from newton till now.
So I thought to go ahead with this one and unify in such a way that it can consumed by any end user in long run.

But I would love to hear your suggestions on this so that we have help other projects also."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ansible-role-tempest to project-update'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > mnaser does make a good point. It's probably better to try and
 > > update the ansible-role-os_tempest bits with what we could use in
 > > tripleo rather than forklift the oooq-extras bits into a new
 > repo,
 > 
 > Thank you mnaser and Alex for the comment, I have looked at the
 > ansible-role-os_tempest and as well as kolla-ansible tempest role.
 > ansible-role-os_tempest has coverage for installing and running
 > tempest from venv and it is branched for each release.
 > Kolla-ansible tempest role has support for running tempest from
 > container.
 > Apart from that, In tripleo-quickstart-extras project,
 > validate-tempest role has support for Installing/configuring/running
 > tempest from venv, rpm package as well as container as currently
 > consumed in Tripleo-CI and support multiple releases starting from
 > newton till now.
 > So I thought to go ahead with this one and unify in such a way that
 > it can consumed by any end user in long run.
 > 
 > But I would love to hear your suggestions on this so that we have
 > help other projects also.

When you say "go ahead with this one", do you mean to go ahead and add the new repository, or to use the existing one?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We can work together on adding RPM support in os_tempest if that is the only shortcoming, with our new distro support added in Rocky, it should be trivial.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Rollcall-Vote'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-10 11:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> We can work together on adding RPM support in os_tempest if that is
 > the only shortcoming, with our new distro support added in Rocky,
 > it should be trivial.

Yes, correct, We will be adding the missing features which is required by TripleO in os_tempest role in order to consume the same'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:39:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > We can work together on adding RPM support in os_tempest if that
 > is
 > > the only shortcoming, with our new distro support added in Rocky,
 > > it should be trivial.
 > 
 > Yes, correct, We will be adding the missing features which is
 > required by TripleO in os_tempest role in order to consume the same

If we don't need to add this new repo to governance, please abandon this patch."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

going to reuse the openstack-ansible-os_tempest role'}]

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-tempest project under tripleo

* validate-tempest ansible role exists under
  openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras repo. We are moving this role
  to a seperate repo so that it can work with tripleo and other projects
  like infrared to run tempest.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589129/
Change-Id: I134a0bf4ec57cb90e6c59df85e6868e671e31c2f

[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 11:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ansible-tempest to tempest-ansible'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we should follow other Tripleo roles names: ansible-role-tripleo-tempest for example.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think we should follow other Tripleo roles names:
 > ansible-role-tripleo-tempest for example.

We are sitting the tempest role in order to work with infrared and tripleo and next iteration we can extend to other community projects.
I am not sure keeping "ansible-role-tripleo-tempest" would be better or can i keep something more generic like ansible-role-tempest?'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-08-06 16:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

@Emilien, short term plan is to manage this role under the tripleo umbrella.  However the larger long term context is that the tempest guys have been working w/ refstack upstream team, the qa team, openstack-ansible, kolla etc to use common tooling when setting up tempest.

This is probably a good reason imho to have an exception made for this new project to not include the tripleo name.

Make sense?'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-08 07:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-08 07:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

REmove https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/blob/master/zuul.d/project.yaml - and then "recheck" this change.

We do not allow import of any Zuul job configuration - those need to go through normal git review test and self-testing.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-08 12:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

One question on the name for consideration inline.

-1 for the extra ACL lines.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-08 12:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-08 17:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

If this role can be broadly usable across projects, openstack-ansible would be happy to join the party. The more hands we have, the smaller the maintenance burden. :)'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-08-10 16:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

going to reuse the openstack-ansible-os_tempest role'}]

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-tempest project under tripleo

* validate-tempest ansible role exists under
  openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras repo. We are moving this role
  to a seperate repo so that it can work with tripleo and other projects
  like infrared to run tempest. Later on we can extend for other
  community project.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589133/

Change-Id: I88bd73b6d05c73f724b49d41c95af433e631e3ae

commit_message:
Branch the openstack-ansible roles

Our roles are generally consumed from shas instead of tags,
and there is no reason to tag them.

It was decided earlier this cycle to stop tagging those
openstack-ansible roles, but continue to branch
them according to our usual procedures.
We are therefore following the devstack model for our roles.

The roles following that model (i.e. the roles which are not deprecated
or are not 'master' branch only) will be unified in a separate
deliverable in the openstack/governance repo,
as "openstack-ansible-roles" [1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589446

Change-Id: I7cc717641b5bf09cd8a9c657848c967566f724c8

subject: Make resource a dict subclass usable by shade layer
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-03 04:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-05 00:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-05 00:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-07 17:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2018-01-08 15:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

"basically dicts that allow object-notation" is mostly what the original Resource (not v2) was, though that became problematic for a bunch of reasons, one of which was separating out body properties from header properties (and URL properties were also sort of bad this way). IIRC we had some special key for headers so you would then do like x["_headers"]["some-header]=1 while you would have just done x["name"]="blah" to set the name in the request body. We were basically trying to be one dict that was internally three dicts: body things, header things, URL things.

For one, that special casing became weird, but it also slightly harder to enforce that only some fields would be sent. You could just add whatever keys/values you wanted to the dict and we'd send them, and that became problematic with servers that validate that they only get known keys. So while you could do x["asdfasdfasdf"]=1 and send that resource instance to some services that would silently ignore it and be fine, some would cough on it and get some sort of error. If we lose that in any of this change, that'd be a fairly large step backward, though again I haven't looked into the implementation. That's sort of how we came to what is now Resource2, which only sends properties that are known on the given Resource2 subclass, so what is documented and what is coded is all that gets sent. We also went that way to just have closer to a "one true way" of doing it, because back a while ago half of our examples used the dict interface (which was not how anyone was writing the actual code) and half used the property names.

I haven't looked into the code yet, just getting caught up on email and reading descriptions, but those are some quick thoughts off the top of my head for a general change in this direction.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-08 15:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Brian- thanks, that's really good background. I definitely like the cleanliness of the object interface better than the mixed dict/object interface. The motivation here is purely about exploring how far down the road we can get of having shade-layer things return unmodified sdk Resource objects. It's entirely possible the answer will be "we can't" in which case we'll just have to have a more complex translation layer.

That said - I had an idea last night about one more thing to try here that would keep the good Resource2 body header separation and the dirty/clean stuff but have the dict layer still work more sanely. I'll poke at that today and see if it's workable...'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-06 23:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-07 14:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-07 14:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-08 14:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-09 00:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-08-09 12:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 04:25:23.000000000', 'message': "Make resource a dict subclass usable by shade layer

Users of shade/openstack.cloud expect munch.Munch objects to be returned
by all the methods. These objects are basically dicts that allow
object-notation access.

In an attempt to minimize the size of the mapping layer between shade
and sdk code, make the Resource objects behave like dicts as well as
like objects. We want the attributes exposed as dictionary attributes to
be the data model defined with the Component descriptors, so we wind up
needing to override the munch methods anyway - at which point munch
itself ceases being valuable.

To test that this works, update list_servers to use
conn.compute.servers() directly. This also involves relying on sdk
normalization, which is cool. Some of shade's attributes are
calculated (like interface_ip), so add a method to the base class which
allows resources to calculate additional attributes and a Calculated
Component that allows us to declare them.

It also became necessary to get access to the Connection from the data
normalization routines in the Resource, so plumb it in through the
Adapter.

A bunch of TODO comments have been added for things that were noticed
while working on this but which would be even larger of a change to
handle in one go.

Change-Id: Ib48f0bfa74231bf3171a798a179f6606177c95b0
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 00:17:46.000000000', 'message': "WIP Make resource a dict subclass usable by shade layer

Users of shade/openstack.cloud expect munch.Munch objects to be returned
by all the methods. These objects are basically dicts that allow
object-notation access.

In an attempt to minimize the size of the mapping layer between shade
and sdk code, make the Resource objects behave like dicts as well as
like objects. We want the attributes exposed as dictionary attributes to
be the data model defined with the Component descriptors, so we wind up
needing to override the munch methods anyway - at which point munch
itself ceases being valuable.

To test that this works, update list_servers to use
conn.compute.servers() directly. This also involves relying on sdk
normalization, which is cool. Some of shade's attributes are
calculated (like interface_ip), so add a method to the base class which
allows resources to calculate additional attributes and a Calculated
Component that allows us to declare them.

It also became necessary to get access to the Connection from the data
normalization routines in the Resource, so plumb it in through the
Adapter.

A bunch of TODO comments have been added for things that were noticed
while working on this but which would be even larger of a change to
handle in one go.

In making the Resource class a dict subclass we stepped on the standard
dict method 'get'. Rename the resource method for getting another
Resource based on the current one to 'fetch'. It's not a **great** API break,
but it's mostly the sort of method used internally, so hopefully it
won't wreck TOO much havoc.

The overall idea here is allowing the shade-layer API to return SDK
Resource objects directly without transforming them with to_dict first.
If we can make that work, it means that a user could use shade and sdk
methods interchangably, being able to do something like:

  # Create server using shade layer
  server = conn.create_server('my-server', auto_ip)
  # reboot server using sdk
  conn.compute.servers.reboot(server, 'HARD')

There is a REALLY ugly hack in here (with a comment) that's needed to
make json.dumps(server) work. It's not a hack we should actually use,
but my brain is too tired right now to figure out how to make it
actually work.

The expanded/detailed/bare parameters to servers() are also crappy and
should be fixed more better.

Co-Authored-By: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: Ib48f0bfa74231bf3171a798a179f6606177c95b0

make json.dumps(server) work. It's not a hack we should actually use,
but my brain is too tired right now to figure out how to make it
actually work.

There is a latent bug in image. A TODO has been left.

Co-Authored-By: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: Ib48f0bfa74231bf3171a798a179f6606177c95b0
"}]
commit_message:
Make resource a dict subclass usable by shade layer

Users of shade/openstack.cloud expect munch.Munch objects to be returned
by all the methods. These objects are basically dicts that allow
object-notation access.

In an attempt to minimize the size of the mapping layer between shade
and sdk code, make the Resource objects behave like dicts as well as
like objects. We want the attributes exposed as dictionary attributes
to be the data model defined with the Component descriptors, so we wind
up needing to override the munch methods anyway - at which point munch
itself ceases being valuable.

he overall idea here is allowing the shade-layer API to return SDK
Resource objects directly without transforming them with to_dict first.
If we can make that work, it means that a user could use shade and sdk
methods interchangably, being able to do something like:

  # Create server using shade layer
  server = conn.create_server('my-server', auto_ip)
  # reboot server using sdk
  conn.compute.servers.reboot(server, 'HARD')

There is a REALLY ugly hack in here (with a comment) that's needed to
make json.dumps(server) work. It's not a hack we should actually use,
but my brain is too tired right now to figure out how to make it
actually work.

There is a latent bug in image. A TODO has been left.

Co-Authored-By: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: Ib48f0bfa74231bf3171a798a179f6606177c95b0

[{'created': '2018-08-10 01:29:28.000000000', 'message': "Move the shebang to /usr/bin/python

In LP#1785245 we made sure to move the shebang script back to
/bin/python. rpm packaging inspect script shebang lines and add Requires
to the rpm. repoclosure checks to make sure that a given repo
(collection of rpm files) has all necessary Requires to be able to
install.

Let's move the shebang to /usr/bin/python which exists and does
not cause repoclosure issues:

python-2.7.5-69.el7_5.x86_64

commit_message:
Move the shebang to /usr/bin/python

In LP#1785245 we made sure to move the shebang script back to
/bin/python. rpm packaging inspect script shebang lines and add Requires
to the rpm. repoclosure checks to make sure that a given repo
(collection of rpm files) has all necessary Requires to be able to
install.

Let's move the shebang to /usr/bin/python which exists and does
not cause repoclosure issues:
[root@compute-0 ~]# docker exec -it nova_compute sh -c 'rpm -qf /usr/bin/python'
python-2.7.5-69.el7_5.x86_64

Change-Id: Iac4236bebab609e78b089b809a433d62c60e28c2
Reported-By: Jon Schlueter <jschluet@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1785245
(cherry picked from commit 7d0a8f1cba8cfdc282bd5172ba9d736614c46c2a)

commit_message:
Remove special handling of stacks

SDK should not be removing keys from the object based on remote version.
The behavior of the objects should be the behavior of the objects.

Also, all objects should have id and name. stack_id and stack_name are
fine for the REST API  - not for the SDK.

Change-Id: I42a6d9d3cbd86a55b92b450d70480c1ead7a7f6d

With start of multi-vif support we've merged a new format of Pods

as values. This is inflexible, as we don't get versioning of the

This commit switches that dictionary to oslo.versionedobject of

commit_message:
Change Pod annotations format to o.vo

With start of multi-vif support we've merged a new format of Pods
annotations i.e. dictionary with interface names as keys and VIF o.vo's
as values. This is inflexible, as we don't get versioning of the
dictionary.

This commit switches that dictionary to oslo.versionedobject of
following structure:

 PodState
   - default_vif: VIFBase
   - additional_vifs: {
       '<ifname>': VIFBase,
       ...
       '<ifname>': VIFBase,
   }

This should help us if we ever decide to change this format.

Related-Bug: 1782366

Depends-On: Ied6b5883cf4bfe6a499813c65b49257de040c4b5
Change-Id: I5bce85029f9edfed56ca216f465226b9bcc0d21b

commit_message:
block_device: Rollback volumes to in-use on DeviceDetachFailed

The call to os-roll_detaching was dropped when
I3800b466a50b1e5f5d1e8c8a963d9a6258af67ee started to catch and reraise
DeviceDetachFailed. This call is required to ensure a volume returns to
an in-use state when the instance is unable to detach.

Closes-Bug: #1786318

commit_message:
Nix 'new in 1.19' from 1.19 sections for rp aggs

In the placement API reference, there is a separate section for
"microversions 1.19 -" for both List and Update resource provider
aggregates, so there's no need for the resource_provider_generation
field to mention that it's "New in version 1.19" in those sections.

Change-Id: I3fd02f21d4af11633c4aeb33925c279a1c3b4abd

[{'created': '2018-06-30 20:01:28.000000000', 'message': 'Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

Closes-Bug: 1779500

commit_message:
Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct
parameter in the Cinder puppet module:

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

This allows backend name overrides to be reflected in
the deployed overcloud.

Change-Id: I851f0a5bdcd82d6bcca78da1f530a1e0b77a757c
Closes-Bug: 1779500

commit_message:
Make tempest point to master

Current tempest on OSA master was not pointing to master which missed a
lot of patches. Many related problem rised up due to tempest out of
date.

subject: Enable recursion when requested by forwarders or users
messages:
[{'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-23 02:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-26 08:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-26 14:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Nobuto, thanks for the patch.

We need to do a bit more to have proper support for recursion (please see the comments).'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

DNS queries by OpenStack VMs come from Floating IP ranges or VLAN provider network ranges since dnsmasq in qdhcp namespace will just use Neutron router's route table or upstream router's routes.

Those network spaces are managed outside of Juju model, so we will not be able to predict those range to setup automatic ACLs. For the time being, we have to rely users' explicit input through charm config.

Pedro's patch has more flexibility to set two separate ACLs, allow-query and allow-recursion so we don't need to rely on implicit fallback to allow-query if allow-recursion is unset. I've asked him to upload a new patchset here to override my one.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586360/"}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-29 23:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-30 03:02:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Generally it looks good to me. I'd like to see additional enhancements to avoid confusions from user point of view."}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-30 08:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-30 20:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-31 07:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-31 08:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2018-07-31 11:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I tested the change and I was able to achieve the desired behavior with queries being forwarded from instances to upstream DNS servers via dnsmasq and a bind server deployed by this charm. At the same time, resolution for instance records (both ML2 dns and instance talking to bind servers) worked as well.'}]

Forwarders do not work unless recursion is enabled, but add some

Change-Id: I53d53decbbae12e0b743aa34421d63a5a5c892f1
Closes-Bug: #1776952
Co-Authored-By: Pedro <pedro.guimaraes@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-31 11:04:05.000000000', 'message': 'Enable recursion when requested by forwarders or users

Forwarders do not work unless recursion is enabled. Also, allow users to
set recursion explicitly when they want BIND9 set up by the charm to act
as a full-service resolver.

Documentation has been updated to warn users to set ACLs when enabling
forwarders or recursion to avoid it from being a open resolver.

Change-Id: I53d53decbbae12e0b743aa34421d63a5a5c892f1
Closes-Bug: #1776952
Co-Authored-By: Pedro <pedro.guimaraes@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable recursion when requested by forwarders or users

Forwarders do not work unless recursion is enabled. Also, allow users to
set recursion explicitly when they want BIND9 set up by the charm to act
as a full-service resolver.

Documentation has been updated to warn users to set ACLs when enabling
forwarders or recursion to avoid it from being a open resolver.

Change-Id: I53d53decbbae12e0b743aa34421d63a5a5c892f1
Closes-Bug: #1776952
Co-Authored-By: Pedro <pedro.guimaraes@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Stop sourcing of functions

I can't see a reason to do this in tools/image_list.sh and appears to
be breaking gentoo DIBs for openstack-infra.

Change-Id: I27b30262f276cac57a0d8a029fb895d49937a2cd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I130e75655ac33b5efd3f91e90ea1fc8903500f1f

commit_message:
support sub provider

With this patch, cyborg can report accelerators information into
placement. Then scheduer can find an appropriate host according to
user requirements.

This patch leverages Nova's code in order to avoid reinventing the wheel.

It is batter that nova can split the placement client to a separated lib.
So other projects can use it easily.

This new client can support provider trees, that is needed by cyborg's
different dirvers.
We can create a sub provider tree easily by the follow method.
class SchedulerReportClient(object):
    def get_provider_tree_and_ensure_root(
           self, context, rp_uuid, name=None,
           parent_provider_uuid=None)

The patch include:
1. add get_ksa_adapter for placement client

2. add placement client

3. update placement config

Missing testcase for this patch.

Change-Id: I1ad9d525fa070dfa0f7cbf374003a74c50de17b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 19:41:04.000000000', 'message': 'Make ResourceTracker.stats node-specific

As of change I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b in
Ocata, the ResourceTracker manages multiple compute nodes
via its "compute_nodes" variable, but the "stats" variable
was still being shared across all nodes, which leads to
leaking stats across nodes in an ironic deployment where
a single nova-compute service host is managing multiple
ironic instances (nodes).

This change makes ResourceTracker.stats node-specific
which fixes the ironic leak but also allows us to remove
the stats deepcopy while iterating over instances which
should improve performance for single-node deployments with
potentially a large number of instances, i.e. vCenter.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to not having change
Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4 in Pike.

Change-Id: I0b9e5b711878fa47ba90e43c0b41437b57cf8ef6
Closes-Bug: #1784705
Closes-Bug: #1777422
(cherry picked from commit b5b7d86bb04f92d21cf954cd6b3463c9fcc637e6)
(cherry picked from commit 7d99f5753f992bd4b58b0aaa7f83f71fb044776f)
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 19:46:49.000000000', 'message': 'Make ResourceTracker.stats node-specific

This change makes ResourceTracker.stats node-specific
which fixes the ironic leak but also allows us to remove
the stats deepcopy while iterating over instances which

potentially a large number of instances, i.e. vCenter.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to not having change
Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4 in Pike.

NOTE(mriedem): The check for node is None was moved from
_do_build_and_run_instance to build_and_run_instance because
the functional tests are using the ChanceScheduler since we
don't have change I12de2e195022593ea2a3e2894f2c3b5226930d4f
and the ChanceScheduler does not return the nodename during

'}]
commit_message:
Make ResourceTracker.stats node-specific

As of change I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b in
Ocata, the ResourceTracker manages multiple compute nodes
via its "compute_nodes" variable, but the "stats" variable
was still being shared across all nodes, which leads to
leaking stats across nodes in an ironic deployment where
a single nova-compute service host is managing multiple
ironic instances (nodes).

This change makes ResourceTracker.stats node-specific
which fixes the ironic leak but also allows us to remove
the stats deepcopy while iterating over instances which
should improve performance for single-node deployments with
potentially a large number of instances, i.e. vCenter.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to not having change
Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4 in Pike.

NOTE(mriedem): The check for node is None was moved from
_do_build_and_run_instance to build_and_run_instance because
the functional tests are using the ChanceScheduler since we
don't have change I12de2e195022593ea2a3e2894f2c3b5226930d4f
and the ChanceScheduler does not return the nodename during
select_destinations so the compute has to get it from the
driver.

Change-Id: I0b9e5b711878fa47ba90e43c0b41437b57cf8ef6
Closes-Bug: #1784705
Closes-Bug: #1777422
(cherry picked from commit b5b7d86bb04f92d21cf954cd6b3463c9fcc637e6)
(cherry picked from commit 7d99f5753f992bd4b58b0aaa7f83f71fb044776f)

commit_message:
Remove pip from packages installed

None of the hosts need pip installed any more. Everything
installed on the host is now a distribution package, and
all pip packages are inside a virtualenv. As such, this
role does not need to install pip/setuptoools/wheel any
more.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589633
Change-Id: I4ea7c5eaf3ad1874c16bfc72b5a13f7f3c7986a9

[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:32:44.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.

Change-Id: Iea3189cf1ab4d22a6179350d22d98f3adf4bb429
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iea3189cf1ab4d22a6179350d22d98f3adf4bb429

commit_message:
track down why inventory placement calls multiply

DO NOT MERGE

There's been an uptick in the number of placement REST API calls made
from the resource tracker -> reportclient -> placement, specifically
around getting inventory information for a provider.

This patch is adding a log message so I can have a better look at why
the reportclient thinks inventory is changing for a provider every time
update_available_resource() runs in the resource tracker.

Change-Id: I966adc88c239bf87a43f8d222debed7c7d916d2e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 08:52:31.000000000', 'message': "Unified code style nullable description parameter

We define unified parameter types for validating a request reference,
such as 'boolean', 'url' and 'description'. In order to keep the code
style consistent, each schema should use it in addition to its own
specific parameters.

For catalog schema, parameter 'description' in _region_properties and
_endpoint_group_properties has different definitions, which reduces the
readability of the code.

Change-Id: Ia94bc3368f3623a91ffde9a78d2310f8a8e290c2
"}]
commit_message:
Unified code style nullable description parameter

We define unified parameter types for validating a request reference,
such as 'boolean', 'url' and 'description'. In order to keep the code
style consistent, each schema should use it in addition to its own
specific parameters.

For catalog schema, parameter 'description' in _region_properties and
_endpoint_group_properties has different definitions, which reduces the
readability of the code.

Change-Id: Ia94bc3368f3623a91ffde9a78d2310f8a8e290c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 21:52:52.000000000', 'message': 'VSA: Concurrent request handling in attachment

Issue: VSA cannot have two server created with
same host name, so when concurrent request tries
to create server only one request succeed and
subsequent request gets response of exception
of already exists.

This fix handle concurrent request and ensure
only one request with same host name request
server creation on VSA.

Change-Id: I41815510f0e6bf865a46d1efd7b73f613ddbe736
Closes-Bug: #1779654
(cherry picked from commit 8a039bb5cd00baac5e97081621e57820586a33d5)
'}]
commit_message:
VSA: Concurrent request handling in attachment

Issue: VSA cannot have two server created with
same host name, so when concurrent request tries
to create server only one request succeed and
subsequent request gets response of exception
of already exists.

This fix handle concurrent request and ensure
only one request with same host name request
server creation on VSA.

Change-Id: I41815510f0e6bf865a46d1efd7b73f613ddbe736
Closes-Bug: #1779654
(cherry picked from commit 8a039bb5cd00baac5e97081621e57820586a33d5)

commit_message:
Add microversion support for consistency groups

Volume consistency groups will be replaced by volume generic
groups in Cinder API microversion 3.15. This patch is the
first of several patches to handle this transistion.

This patch adds microversion support so that features
can be checked against what version of the client and
service are running.

In this patch, all consistency groups tabs will be hidden
if microversion 3.15 is available, and generic groups
are not supported (which will be true until they are
added in a subsequent patch).

Partially-Implements: blueprint cinder-generic-volume-groups
Partially-Implements: blueprint microversion-support
Change-Id: Ifd40aef0ff94309f790a213fe220e47210edaac4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 20:47:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix _attachment_reserve to not allow attaching an invalid status volume

It is currently possible to create a volume attachment for a server
when the volume is in error status because of the override logic
in the _attachment_reserve method. What results is that the volume
attach operation fails in nova-compute which rolls back and deletes
the volume attachment, which puts the volume into 'available' status
because it no longer has any attachments, which in fact it should
have never allowed the attachment create/reserve in the first place.

This updates the override logic such that a volume without any
attachments which is in an invalid status will result in an error
being raised.

Change-Id: Id9cf2f510684cd296ffbcaf53d11889cfe8973b9
Closes-Bug: #1785050
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _attachment_reserve to not allow attaching an invalid status volume

It is currently possible to create a volume attachment for a server
when the volume is in error status because of the override logic
in the _attachment_reserve method. What results is that the volume
attach operation fails in nova-compute which rolls back and deletes
the volume attachment, which puts the volume into 'available' status
because it no longer has any attachments, which in fact it should
have never allowed the attachment create/reserve in the first place.

This updates the override logic such that a volume without any
attachments which is in an invalid status will result in an error
being raised.

Change-Id: Id9cf2f510684cd296ffbcaf53d11889cfe8973b9
Closes-Bug: #1785050

commit_message:
validate-indentation was failing locally for me

grep -E '^\s+[A-Z]+\s' was matching any
"  a "
"  FOO "

where this was trying to only catch " FOO " case

Change-Id: Ife64cb9f02b3f1463d5143e57629418bc478de49
(cherry picked from commit b7c0f053b0e0e4b48a2cd69fce0096d106a8d219)

[{'created': '2018-02-20 22:44:10.000000000', 'message': "Avoid exploding if guest refuses to detach a volume

if lots of dirty data needs flushing. Right now, we let the failure

commit_message:
Avoid exploding if guest refuses to detach a volume

When we run detach_volume(), the guest has to respond to the ACPI
eject request in order for us to proceed. It may not do this at all
if the volume is mounted or in-use, or may not by the time we time out
if lots of dirty data needs flushing. Right now, we let the failure
exception bubble up to our caller and we log a nasty stack trace, which
doesn't really convey the reason (and that it's an expected and
reasonable thing to happen).

Thus, this patch catches that, logs the situation at warning level and
avoids the trace.

Change-Id: I3800b466a50b1e5f5d1e8c8a963d9a6258af67ee
Closes-Bug: #1750680

commit_message:
Expose a bug that issue token with project-scope gets error

When sets project-scoped with project ID key but the value is a 
domain id, it retures 400 BadRequest: "object of type 'NoneType' 
has no len()". 
The expected code should be 404 project not found internal and 
401 to end user.

This patch exposes this bug and it will be fixed in the following patch.

Partial-bug: #1784536
Change-Id: I67983bdd300452a5bff947ca3bcfb77a0e6b4574

[{'created': '2018-08-03 09:42:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make dvr router port creation retriable

On concurrent router interface creation DB retries are usual.
In case of DVR there are 2 sources for retries: csnat and dvr
router ports creation.
This patch wraps dvr port creation with retry to avoid duplicate router
subnet violation when retrying the main add_router_interface().
See bug for details.

Change-Id: Ia3c6429a82a9c349eb9577bf255d34f16c6d602e
Closes-Bug: #1783728
(cherry picked from commit 314a06359e4eaa7a858f2ba88c98b0a849376aba)
'}]
commit_message:
Make dvr router port creation retriable

On concurrent router interface creation DB retries are usual.
In case of DVR there are 2 sources for retries: csnat and dvr
router ports creation.
This patch wraps dvr port creation with retry to avoid duplicate router
subnet violation when retrying the main add_router_interface().
See bug for details.

Change-Id: Ia3c6429a82a9c349eb9577bf255d34f16c6d602e
Closes-Bug: #1783728
(cherry picked from commit 314a06359e4eaa7a858f2ba88c98b0a849376aba)

The resource variable, originally containing the resource type, i.e.
'lease', was reassigned with a lease object before being used in the
exception message. As a result, the message displayed a dictionary of

Change-Id: If4cb03cfb4a895c11e3952f0f1b79e0c7d14de8c

commit_message:
Fix exception message when there are leases with the same name

The resource variable, originally containing the resource type, i.e.
'lease', was reassigned with a lease object before being used in the
exception message. As a result, the message displayed a dictionary of
lease values, instead of "type 'lease'".

Change-Id: If4cb03cfb4a895c11e3952f0f1b79e0c7d14de8c
Closes-Bug: #1786030
(cherry picked from commit 92e26f3417ea2d50bb8f5652bc3073b917a64dcf)

[{'created': '2018-07-06 15:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Allow musl based distros to resolve using search

Musl based distros only perform search in case the ndots config
(which defaults to 1) is bigger than the amount of dots in the
query. This means that if you try to lookup a dns name like:
kubernetes.default.svc it will not try to use the search domain

commit_message:
Allow musl based distros to resolve using search

Musl based distros only perform search in case the ndots config
(which defaults to 1) is bigger than the amount of dots in the
query. This means that if you try to lookup a dns name like:
kubernetes.default.svc it will not try to use the search domain
and the communication will fail.

Change-Id: Ic1af364648de3dd401bb5e77800c2c9675f1becf
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <asegurap@redhat.com>

commit_message:
drop deprecated oadm

oadm has been deprecated for a while in favor of just running
oc adm. This patch removes oadm from the environment and substitutes
its usage.

Change-Id: Ifd9f178104e1fca963a3e3fb0c2d5b1b526c3fa1
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <celebdor@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add enable_proxy_headers_parsing option for placement

This option determines if the middleware should parse the
headers or not. Can be used in case if application is behind
the reverse proxy.

Change-Id: Ib1b30581483826b692181b14ccb6afa125190cc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 19:41:04.000000000', 'message': "Add recreate test for RT.stats bug 1784705

With change I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b in
Ocata, we changed the ComputeManager to manage a single
ResourceTracker and that single ResourceTracker will
manage multiple compute nodes. The only time a single
nova-compute service hosts multiple compute nodes is for
ironic where there is a compute node per instance. The
problem is the ResourceTracker.stats variable, unlike the
ResourceTracker.compute_nodes variable, is not node-specific
so it's possible for node stats to leak across nodes based
on how the stats are used (and copied).

This change adds a functional recreate test to show the issue
before it's fixed. The fixture setup had to be tweaked a
bit to avoid modifying class variables by reference between
test cases.

Change-Id: Icc5f615baa1042347ec1699eb84ba0670445b995
Related-Bug: #1784705
(cherry picked from commit fc05626d43571733da0803df0fd9a7c69766b8fd)
(cherry picked from commit cc8167a1914a70ea7b336856285df2571a754ca0)
"}]
commit_message:
Add recreate test for RT.stats bug 1784705

With change I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b in
Ocata, we changed the ComputeManager to manage a single
ResourceTracker and that single ResourceTracker will
manage multiple compute nodes. The only time a single
nova-compute service hosts multiple compute nodes is for
ironic where there is a compute node per instance. The
problem is the ResourceTracker.stats variable, unlike the
ResourceTracker.compute_nodes variable, is not node-specific
so it's possible for node stats to leak across nodes based
on how the stats are used (and copied).

This change adds a functional recreate test to show the issue
before it's fixed. The fixture setup had to be tweaked a
bit to avoid modifying class variables by reference between
test cases.

Change-Id: Icc5f615baa1042347ec1699eb84ba0670445b995
Related-Bug: #1784705
(cherry picked from commit fc05626d43571733da0803df0fd9a7c69766b8fd)
(cherry picked from commit cc8167a1914a70ea7b336856285df2571a754ca0)

commit_message:
Clean up group members in db when delete

If an instance is associcated with a group, its record in the
instance_group_members table will not get erased when the instance
is completely deleted. It will result in the table keeping growing
and the data somewhat misleading.

This patch tries to clean instance associated group member when
an instance is being deleted in the manager.

Closes-Bug: #1751186
Change-Id: If931ddcbbb062e27936da8bf9214dbcc29664bf5

commit_message:
Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section www_authenticate_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As www_authenticate_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily
reachable for the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate
auth_url as Keystone URL.

Change-Id: I52fdeaaf773e0fc7e111e58ffb02ef9485eed260

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

In order to follow the new PTI for doc build, this patch:
1)removes unused build_sphinx in setup.cfg
2)move doc dependencies from test-requirements.txt to doc/requirements.txt
3)update tox.ini

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ibbc91e737bfc017b4017feb91622a8619f89e7fa

Add support for openSUSE

This patch aims to ensure that this role is functional in opensuse-42x.

Change-Id: Icdf2787ba6de2f7d870973e1ce6bee16b8074575

commit_message:
Cut kuryr-kubernetes rocky RC1

Even if kuryr-kubernetes project is set as cycle-with-intermediary we'll
be cutting a rc1 release in order to ack a FF for the cycle.

Change-Id: I481e180e2b5eaa67d14bf5cce3fd8fe7d3eec55b

subject: Use TLSv1.2 for secure VNC access
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-08 18:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-08 18:36:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I want to test this with the nova-next job, which needs to be fixed because it's currently not using SSL for VNC:

Aug 07 13:36:18.883418 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0001180493 nova-novncproxy[1891]: INFO nova.console.websocketproxy [-]   - No SSL/TLS support (no cert file)"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-08-08 20:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/589992/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 08m 10s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-08-09 00:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-22540 : SUCCESS in 58m 02s'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2018-08-09 15:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-09 19:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-09 19:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

openssl should already use systemwide settings for the ssl_version underneath, so there is no need in hard-coding a version here. In fact, it would cause systemwide settings not to be honored.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2018-08-10 08:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, I didn't mean to suggest we should abandon the change/bug, as not all distros have crypto policy support systemwide. 

Rather, that we should

1. make sure the out of the box behaviour is to honour openssl defaults
2. provide a nova.conf setting for the protocol version, which allows an ordered list of versions to be set by the admin. eg might set something like  vnc_tls_protocol = [ "tls1.3", "tls1.2"]'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 18:35:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use TLSv1.2 for secure VNC access

The ssl.wrap_socket method [1] defaults to using PROTOCOL_SSLv23, but
QEMU supports more modern TLS versions, so we can use PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1771773

Change-Id: I2b0a775f9f0bd1357e6512cdbf06e3281a4b25a1
'}]
commit_message:
Use TLSv1.2 for secure VNC access

The ssl.wrap_socket method [1] defaults to using PROTOCOL_SSLv23, but
QEMU supports more modern TLS versions, so we can use PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1771773

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-08-10 07:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 12:11:37.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib96db55d74687fe23fb0c0e7bcc1e8d8e31495dd
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib96db55d74687fe23fb0c0e7bcc1e8d8e31495dd

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ifca899bc801d95c9a82df439d0d1f50d51bee255

commit_message:
better handle existing keywords files/directories

The existing directories are needed for stage building (a part of the
Gentoo build process).  Normally these directories are empty, but there
are times where overrides need to be defined.  This commit handles
existing overrides for keywords.  For historical reasons the overrides
were able to be put in different files and directories, this
centralizes them.

This also updates the version of openssl/cryptography that works with
or without bindist.

Change-Id: I62c934ed305a711a4a9a3ef01fa55ad142aebb78

commit_message:
Return 400 when compute host is not found

Previously user was getting a 500 error code for ComputeHostNotFound
if they are using latest microversion that does live migration in
async. This patches changes return response to 400 as 500 internal
server error should not be returned to the user for failures due to
user error that can be fixed by changing to request on client side.

Change-Id: I7a9de211ecfaa7f2816fbf8bcd73ebbdd990643c
closes-bug:1643623

In 705d2a0b7b78813fb84636ac262030bc7dd6be08 we added a hack to handle
traslation error when deleting a pool member resource with the pool
already deleted in octavia. After the previous patch in this series
we can remove this hack.

commit_message:
Revert octavia pool member delete fix

In 705d2a0b7b78813fb84636ac262030bc7dd6be08 we added a hack to handle
traslation error when deleting a pool member resource with the pool
already deleted in octavia. After the previous patch in this series
we can remove this hack.

Change-Id: I459cd5e2c3dc8be23e299a2b8360a32b52d8e071
Story: #1747836
Task: 23279

commit_message:
Remove duplicate entries from /etc/default/grub

Due to the fact that the code in the lines following this
patchset add some lines to /etc/default/grub, we need
to make sure that the original lines containing the
variables which will be added are not duplicated
therefore avoiding confusion at best and potential
misbehaviour in case it is not the last entry in
the file which prevails.

Change-Id: I4b7bfea3310aef55e3819579720c284ca132e016

commit_message:
Fix libvirt_type kvm for overcloud deploy

Apparently after merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584380
we got a consistent failure in the 3node and scn008 jobs:

invalid argument: could not find capabilities for domaintype=kvm

Try to enable kvm nested virtualization and switch back to default
qemu full emulation if kvm-{intel|amd} module cannot be loaded.

In addition, remove the current logic behind ansible_distribution
== 'RedHat' to enable kvm as this condition must run on overcloud
and also depends on cpu capabilities.

Change-Id: Iaa936facc5148ee6ff136db1524584785588c01e
Closes-Bug: #1784017

subject: python3 runtime
messages:
[{'account_id': 28696, 'date': '2018-08-01 12:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-08-07 03:08:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm wondering whether we can make the current python2 version also work well with python3, then we don't have to maintain two versions which are almost identical. They'd have different Dockerfiles though (in fact the only difference seems to be the apt-get part and pip2 vs pip3)."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-07 03:27:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm wondering whether we can make the current python2 version also
 > work well with python3, then we don't have to maintain two versions
 > which are almost identical. They'd have different Dockerfiles
 > though (in fact the only difference seems to be the apt-get part
 > and pip2 vs pip3).

Do you mean we use the same dockerfile to create both runtime for python2 and python3 using some ARG or ENV?"}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-08-07 03:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I'm wondering whether we can make the current python2 version
 > also
 > > work well with python3, then we don't have to maintain two
 > versions
 > > which are almost identical. They'd have different Dockerfiles
 > > though (in fact the only difference seems to be the apt-get part
 > > and pip2 vs pip3).
 > 
 > Do you mean we use the same dockerfile to create both runtime for
 > python2 and python3 using some ARG or ENV?

Is it common to use one single Dockerfile to create different images? If so then one dockerfile would be enough. If not, then we can use two Dockerfiles for them, but share the app which works with both python 2 and 3."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-07 03:40:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > I'm wondering whether we can make the current python2 version
 > > also
 > > > work well with python3, then we don't have to maintain two
 > > versions
 > > > which are almost identical. They'd have different Dockerfiles
 > > > though (in fact the only difference seems to be the apt-get
 > part
 > > > and pip2 vs pip3).
 > >
 > > Do you mean we use the same dockerfile to create both runtime for
 > > python2 and python3 using some ARG or ENV?
 > 
 > Is it common to use one single Dockerfile to create different
 > images? If so then one dockerfile would be enough. If not, then we
 > can use two Dockerfiles for them, but share the app which works
 > with both python 2 and 3.

To make things simple and clear, we could copy the python2 folder. Once python 2 is not supported(in 2020?), we could simply delete the python2 folder."}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-08-07 04:33:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

... 
 > To make things simple and clear, we could copy the python2 folder.
 > Once python 2 is not supported(in 2020?), we could simply delete
 > the python2 folder.

Yeah, that's what this change does. The only concern is that we have to update two places when we make new changes to server.py/cglimit.py. It won't be a tough task though, so we can go this way."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:39:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I'll merge this patch and build a python3 runtime image for testing. Merging this patch won't harm the qinling functional testing because we're using python2 runtime in CI."}]

commit_message:
python3 runtime

Created a new runtime for python3 taking clues from the available python2
runtime. The runtime has been tested on various test functions.

Change-Id: Iccf3360ea5a389a7dfa2b091979c5713062fa73a
Task: 22199
Story: 2002590

'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 08:40:10.000000000', 'message': 'Set Red Hat default SSHD configuration properly

Change-Id: I4803615fb6b8066b0c1afe2b0b7cbbd9d50aff40
'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 08:46:29.000000000', 'message': 'Set Red Hat default SSHD configuration properly

Currently, the sshd configuration generated on RHEL does not reflect
the default RHEL configuration:

Port 22

AcceptEnv LANG LC_*
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key
PrintMotd no
Subsystem sftp /usr/libexec/openssh/sftp-server
UsePAM yes
X11Forwarding yes

The default RHEL sshd configuration has some more stuff in it, especially
regarding the logging and accepted environments:

HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key
SyslogFacility AUTHPRIV
AuthorizedKeysFile	.ssh/authorized_keys
PasswordAuthentication yes
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
GSSAPIAuthentication yes
GSSAPICleanupCredentials no
UsePAM yes
X11Forwarding yes
AcceptEnv LANG LC_CTYPE LC_NUMERIC LC_TIME LC_COLLATE LC_MONETARY LC_MESSAGES
AcceptEnv LC_PAPER LC_NAME LC_ADDRESS LC_TELEPHONE LC_MEASUREMENT
AcceptEnv LC_IDENTIFICATION LC_ALL LANGUAGE
AcceptEnv XMODIFIERS
Subsystem	sftp	/usr/libexec/openssh/sftp-server

In addition, with release >Queens, the configuration is managed directly in
tripleo-heat-templates, and will look like the standard RHEL one.

Change-Id: I4803615fb6b8066b0c1afe2b0b7cbbd9d50aff40
'}]
commit_message:
Set Red Hat default SSHD configuration properly

Currently, the sshd configuration generated on RHEL does not reflect
the default RHEL configuration:

Port 22

AcceptEnv LANG LC_*
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key
PrintMotd no
Subsystem sftp /usr/libexec/openssh/sftp-server
UsePAM yes
X11Forwarding yes

The default RHEL sshd configuration has some more stuff in it, especially
regarding the logging and accepted environments:

HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key
SyslogFacility AUTHPRIV
AuthorizedKeysFile	.ssh/authorized_keys
PasswordAuthentication yes
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
GSSAPIAuthentication yes
GSSAPICleanupCredentials no
UsePAM yes
X11Forwarding yes
AcceptEnv LANG LC_CTYPE LC_NUMERIC LC_TIME LC_COLLATE LC_MONETARY LC_MESSAGES
AcceptEnv LC_PAPER LC_NAME LC_ADDRESS LC_TELEPHONE LC_MEASUREMENT
AcceptEnv LC_IDENTIFICATION LC_ALL LANGUAGE
AcceptEnv XMODIFIERS
Subsystem	sftp	/usr/libexec/openssh/sftp-server

In addition, with release >Queens, the configuration is managed directly in
tripleo-heat-templates, and will look like the standard RHEL one.

Change-Id: I4803615fb6b8066b0c1afe2b0b7cbbd9d50aff40

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-04 03:51:44.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4717d3b8f73600a87bf0438e29a8c6ac0fcebcb6
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4717d3b8f73600a87bf0438e29a8c6ac0fcebcb6

commit_message:
Break out image prepare into its own "service"

This makes the docker-registry service focused on installing the
registry, as it should be. Also this makes it possible to invoke this
service during overcloud deploy too.

This change also switches to calling the tripleo-common script
tripleo-container-image-prepare instead of the full openstack command.
This will allow a mistral image to do a prepare without depending on
the python-tripleoclient package.

The {{role}}Services and {{role}}Count are propagated to
tripleo-container-image-prepare so that images are filtered correctly.

sudo is used instead of become:true so that the tripleo-common mistral
sudoers pattern matches.

Depends-On: Ic1648e43f45bb7604d4c0f9abf247a475fb23707
Change-Id: Ibc16bed673de7b22cd8eef3f6fb0d45871083873
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Add sudoers entry for tripleo-container-image-prepare

This is required for the mistral user to call this script, which is
needed by change I2bd53ac64d6ae7a5bb536fa82b1c70a73d883ba8

Change-Id: Ic1648e43f45bb7604d4c0f9abf247a475fb23707
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

'}, {'created': '2018-07-27 03:44:40.000000000', 'message': 'Action to perform container image prepare

This action will be called in the deployment workflow just after
validation. It does the following:

- Fetches the plan, environment files and role data
- Builds a merged environment from the fetched plans
- If a ContainerImagePrepare parameter is defined, do a dry-run
  prepare to determine the image parameters for when the actual prepare
  is run during the deployment.
- Write the resulting image parameters to
  environments/containers-default-parameters.yaml and insert that file
  into the environments file list in the plan

This dry-run prepare is the same approach used for containerized
undercloud deployment. Doing a dry-run is fast compared to a full
deploy because there are no image transfers or build performed, only
inspect calls to image registries. The actual prepare will be done
during the deployment when change

commit_message:
Action to perform container image prepare

This action will be called in the deployment workflow just after
validation. It does the following:

- Fetches the plan, environment files and role data
- Builds a merged environment from the fetched plans
- If a ContainerImagePrepare parameter is defined, do a dry-run
  prepare to determine the image parameters for when the actual prepare
  is run during the deployment.
- Write the resulting image parameters to
  environments/containers-default-parameters.yaml and insert that file
  into the environments file list in the plan

This dry-run prepare is the same approach used for containerized
undercloud deployment. Doing a dry-run is fast compared to a full
deploy because there are no image transfers or build performed, only
inspect calls to image registries. The actual prepare will be done
during the deployment when change
I8b0c5e630e63ef6a2e6f70f1eb00fd02f4cfd1c0 lands.

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Change-Id: Id5a4bec2d82e69ef53e7809984b4adba67deef3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 02:53:41.000000000', 'message': 'DeployedServer support for cidr via get_attr

Change I92ee0f9a2107cdf1ca5903d3756a235a79c36c73 implemented a
conditional for ControlPlaneSubnetCidr to be resolved using get_attr
and a str_split. DeployedServer documentation specifies that this
value should be provided to DeployedServerPortMap as a numeric value

This change provides support for both via a yaql expression, and adds
a deprecation note to switch to the full cidr format.

commit_message:
DeployedServer support for cidr via get_attr

Change I92ee0f9a2107cdf1ca5903d3756a235a79c36c73 implemented a
conditional for ControlPlaneSubnetCidr to be resolved using get_attr
and a str_split. DeployedServer documentation specifies that this
value should be provided to DeployedServerPortMap as a numeric value
(ie; 24) rather than full cidr (ie; 192.168.24.0/24), which causes the
str_split to fail.

This change provides support for both via a yaql expression, and adds
a deprecation note to switch to the full cidr format.

Change-Id: I6d4422b4f1aa52aee2954eb447008d3d24fe8736

subject: Periodic fs050: add promotion hash in "previous" function
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 14:09:31.000000000', 'message': 'Periodic fs050: add promotion hash in "previous" function

For the first time we are adding an upgrade job to the promotion
pipeline. Since the release in these jobs is
promotion-testing-hash-{release}, we need to add a case to the function
that calculates the previous release of the upgrade.
We'll need to update also the emit_releases_script for this to work with
this featureset.

Change-Id: I89e349b3ff563e5db59173f4751a52783d63f1ac
'}]
commit_message:
Periodic fs050: add promotion hash in "previous" function

For the first time we are adding an upgrade job to the promotion
pipeline. Since the release in these jobs is
promotion-testing-hash-{release}, we need to add a case to the function
that calculates the previous release of the upgrade.
We'll need to update also the emit_releases_script for this to work with
this featureset.

Change-Id: I89e349b3ff563e5db59173f4751a52783d63f1ac

commit_message:
Release port if failed to connect network

When failed to call docker.connect_container_to_network, the preserved
port is still occupied and can not be used again.
     It is more reasonable release this exiting port.

Change-Id: Id4a0cb73f34c21c66db6b2ca9dd408247a6c04ef
