revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 14:38:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

This patch is necessary until the tox_install.sh removal [1] is merged in.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555788

Note: This commit includes the following unrelated changes
to pass the gate.
(Actually I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850 might not
be necessary on this branch. But I included it as it was a part
of the original commit on master.)
----------------------------------------
Disable failing style checks (W503, E402) for now.

I (yamamoto) guess they are new with pycodestyle 2.4.0.

Related-Bug: #1762795
Change-Id: Ib35d0718bf1410dc8e5c10bb185a00837f2d8b52
----------------------------------------
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib8493a9a2ec30cafa70a67a6f5fd1fee29432ad7
----------------------------------------
Port rally plugins to use proper modules

Sometime ago, all OpenStack related stuff moved from the main repository
to the separate one - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack .
All further development and maintance will be done only in a new
repository. As for first major release, the structure is not changed, so
only imports should be changed.

Change-Id: I796e247bcbafc9c5b6d14e30a52e936b16157b8d
(cherry picked from commit 5e82157f3cfcd437e0716356df0cfc06c575e29b)
----------------------------------------
Add dummy docstrings to avoid Sphinx 1.7.x warnings

We need to workaround this locally because:
- It's unclear how long os-vif patch [1] will take
  to be merged.
- While Neutron patch [2] has been merged, docs build on
  gate is using released versions of dependencies.

The idea was taken from keystone. [3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577028/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577029/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578121/

Related-Bug: #1771092
Change-Id: I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Note: This commit includes the following unrelated changes
to pass the gate.
(Actually I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850 might not
be necessary on this branch. But I included it as it was a part
of the original commit on master.)
----------------------------------------
Pin rally to 0.12.1

Rally plugin after version 0.12.1 installs the new and latest
rally-openstack, which has higher requirements of packages and is not
constrained by pike's upper-constraints.txt during installation. This
causes problem on stable/pike and older stable branches: keystone
service is not able to start (ContextualVersionConflict, see
screen-keystone.txt)

The patch that introduced the new behaviour:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575064/4/devstack/lib/rally

----------------------------------------
Disable failing style checks (W503, E402) for now.

I (yamamoto) guess they are new with pycodestyle 2.4.0.

Related-Bug: #1762795
Change-Id: Ib35d0718bf1410dc8e5c10bb185a00837f2d8b52
----------------------------------------
Add dummy docstrings to avoid Sphinx 1.7.x warnings

We need to workaround this locally because:
- It's unclear how long os-vif patch [1] will take
  to be merged.
- While Neutron patch [2] has been merged, docs build on
  gate is using released versions of dependencies.

The idea was taken from keystone. [3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577028/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577029/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578121/

Related-Bug: #1771092
Change-Id: I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850
----------------------------------------

Conflicting file:
  tox.ini - from upper-constraints we need stable/pike here, which is
      already set
  rally-jobs/plugins/network_plugin.py - because rally has to be pinned,
      the "Port rally plugins to use proper modules" part of the
      backport has to be left out

Co-Authored-By: eeldill <elod.illes@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: OpenStack Release Bot <infra-root@openstack.org>

subject: Fix missing device_id after recreating all listeners
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 14:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing device_id after recreating all listeners

When all listeners are removed from a loadbalancer, the driver will
shutdown the port and clear the "device_id" and "device_owner"
attributes on the vip port. The "device_ower" will get re-added in
plug_vip_port once a listener is added back to the loadbalancer.  This
however doesn't happen for the "device_id" and the id that needs to be
added there (the id of the loadbalancer) is not available in
plug_vip_port.
This commit tries to address the issue by keeping the device_id set in
"unplug_vip_port".

Story: 1626093
Task: 5420

Change-Id: Ibdd847322f8a734eb932235918ccdfa6ffdda63e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing device_id after recreating all listeners

When all listeners are removed from a loadbalancer, the driver will
shutdown the port and clear the "device_id" and "device_owner"
attributes on the vip port. The "device_ower" will get re-added in
plug_vip_port once a listener is added back to the loadbalancer.  This
however doesn't happen for the "device_id" and the id that needs to be
added there (the id of the loadbalancer) is not available in
plug_vip_port.
This commit tries to address the issue by keeping the device_id set in
"unplug_vip_port".

Story: 1626093
Task: 5420

Change-Id: Ibdd847322f8a734eb932235918ccdfa6ffdda63e

commit_message:
Remove use_mox directive

As of horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later the use_mox directive is unecessary so we can remove it.
So remove it from the manila-ui and bump the requirements to b2.

Change-Id: Ieb7f43d7415431c316b398cdbafcede0218292f5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use /var/lib/kolla... path for TLS certificate

Like every other cert, this should be using the /var/lib/kolla... path,
this would copy the appropriate certificate and get it into a path where
we can subsequently get the appropraite permissions.

Change-Id: Ic262a0c398a0c8ad52695016b94c00710b0a12b3
Related-Bug: #1785059

commit_message:
Bug fix: calculate md5 on non-unicode strings

The md5 is used for calculating a hash for
the active actions. The problem is that their
targets sometime have unicode vitrage_id and
sometimes string vitrage_id, so the md5 is
different.

The solution: convert to str before calculating.

Change-Id: I4f6de84dba7f1041a56ce2bc1ac25a5826e164a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-06 11:13:31.000000000', 'message': 'Update nova network info when doing rebuild for evacuate operation

When nova evacuate or host-evacuate are used to recreate instances with
sriov ports the instances are allocated new device ids on the target and
neutron is updated accordingly. However the network info data passed
to the driver spawn method is not updated and thus the instance tries
to use the device id they were allocated on the source node. If a pre
existing instance is using that device id or no such device exists on
the target node then the instance will fail to start.

Change-Id: I860ab9cf3f9a38bd4ea5bceecda8105b6fee93dc
Closes-Bug: #1630698

commit_message:
Update nova network info when doing rebuild for evacuate operation

When nova evacuate or host-evacuate are used to recreate instances with
sriov ports the instances are allocated new device ids on the target and
neutron is updated accordingly. However the network info data passed
to the driver spawn method is not updated and thus the instance tries
to use the device id they were allocated on the source node. If a pre
existing instance is using that device id or no such device exists on
the target node then the instance will fail to start.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Webster <steven.webster@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I860ab9cf3f9a38bd4ea5bceecda8105b6fee93dc
Closes-Bug: #1630698
Related-Bug: #1677621

commit_message:
Exclude pike from keystone only cont->cont upgrade

As ocata is not containerized we cannot exercise a
container -> container upgrade as ocatata -> pike,
we have special jobs to check non-cont -> cont to
check that.

Closes-Bug: 1786016

Change-Id: I0af68e9b89cc4be287658bf89b945f9f4d4ca495

commit_message:
Fix host validity check for live-migration

When live migrating instance to invalid host, live migration fails
with host not found and sets instance task state to migrating.

This change handles host validity in API layer before changing instance
task_state to 'MIGRATING' and raise proper exception on invalid host.

Change-Id: I7c5e80298b9adf1bd53cc6c464a3744b5397b7e8
Related-Bug: #1643623
Closes-Bug: #1785031

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-21 00:07:22.000000000', 'message': "Don't change INIT_COMPLETE resources to CHECK_COMPLETE

We assume that only resources that are in INIT_COMPLETE need to be created
(as opposed to updated). If we run a check on a resource that hasn't been
created yet, we shouldn't change the status to CHECK_COMPLETE because
thereafter we will try to update it.

Changing the status to CHECK_FAILED (as we do if the resource supports
handle_check()) is OK because the resource will get replaced on the next
update anyway.

Change-Id: Iaadf3b57b0e8edc76d338c017dbd05bf2a37698f
Story: #2003062
Task: 23102
"}, {'created': '2018-08-06 13:25:42.000000000', 'message': "Don't change INIT_COMPLETE resources to CHECK_COMPLETE

We assume that only resources that are in INIT_COMPLETE need to be created
(as opposed to updated). If we run a check on a resource that hasn't been
created yet, we shouldn't change the status to CHECK_COMPLETE because
thereafter we will try to update it.

Changing the status to CHECK_FAILED (as we do if the resource supports
handle_check()) is OK because the resource will get replaced on the next
update anyway.

Change-Id: Iaadf3b57b0e8edc76d338c017dbd05bf2a37698f
Story: #2003062
Task: 23102
"}]
commit_message:
Don't change INIT_COMPLETE resources to CHECK_COMPLETE

We assume that only resources that are in INIT_COMPLETE need to be created
(as opposed to updated). If we run a check on a resource that hasn't been
created yet, we shouldn't change the status to CHECK_COMPLETE because
thereafter we will try to update it.

Changing the status to CHECK_FAILED (as we do if the resource supports
handle_check()) is OK because the resource will get replaced on the next
update anyway.

Change-Id: Iaadf3b57b0e8edc76d338c017dbd05bf2a37698f
Story: #2003062
Task: 23102

commit_message:
Docs: Add guide to migrate instance with snapshot

Import the user guide cli-use-snapshots-to-migrate-instances
available on the old openstack-manuals repository.

This user guide describe how to migrate an instance based on a cloud
to another.

It is updated with openstack cli commands.

Change-Id: I17c87ee90b3d271a54026b8bdbad066bdc750c38

commit_message:
Remove wait statement for supplemental node

Doesn't seem to be needed, and breaks nowadays with an "invalid ioctl
call" error.

Change-Id: I6bdf29c2bb1b186deff76cfa76b7386653100637

commit_message:
Correct DSE timeout for several policy_model actions

Correct several potentially longer running actions to use
the longer dse timeout rather than the standard dse time out.

Change-Id: I5202f60005ba9cd356de5d3baba5b7e5b9d0e0c5
Closes-Bug: 1785901

subject: Revert "Enable pipelining for ansible"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 5241, 'name': 'Martin Magr', 'email': 'mmagr@redhat.com', 'username': 'mmagr'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-08 11:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-08-08 12:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure that buys us more than we loose for CI job time overall improvements"}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-08 20:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMO option which makes project fail to run successfully with not-that-much-relevant message is a bigger problem from the usability perspective than letting CI jobs enabling the pipelining themselves. But fair enough. Let me know if I should abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-08-09 10:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thank you Martin for bringing this up. How many regressions did we get? If only one, it would be nice to fix it and abandon this patch, as pipeline added CI boost so we have less jobs in "Time out" state. Anyway, nice catch.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-09 11:17:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't understand what you are trying to say Sergii. This patch is fixing the regression. The regression is that now again some users won't be able to successfully deploy using tripleo-quickstart unless they are aware that they need to disable pipelining or modify their /etc/sudoers file.

I'm not against running CI jobs with pipelining enabled, though I'm not sure that having it enabled by default, when we know that it makes some use cases fail, make sense."}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-09 11:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 11:25:59.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Enable pipelining for ansible"

The patch caused a regression. For more details please check [1]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1714917
This reverts commit a710d70a296f53cdf18666662861e1a1439f6903.

Change-Id: Ic40d526d042f9ddc8b8e4ed1be0edd5cfd3ebaf6
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable pipelining for ansible"

The patch caused a regression. For more details please check [1]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1714917
This reverts commit a710d70a296f53cdf18666662861e1a1439f6903.

Change-Id: Ic40d526d042f9ddc8b8e4ed1be0edd5cfd3ebaf6

commit_message:
bump req python-monascaclient>=1.12.1

python-monascaclient 1.12.0 experiences a issue around Session
when paired with osc-lib 1.11.0. The issue is resolved in
1.12.1.

Relevant patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579139/

FFE: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/133064.html

Change-Id: I437c7141fdb405ee4506abae49ecc40525297656

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 13:52:46.000000000', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I69430899e381f515ee304e9623feb972e5400639
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I69430899e381f515ee304e9623feb972e5400639

Fix coverage test

1. We should use the report in `cover` directory instead of `cover-master`.
2. simplify job definiton base on tox-cover.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.9

This patch:
- updates all the roles to the latest available stable SHAs
- copies the release notes from the updated roles into the integrated repo
- updates all the OpenStack Service SHAs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589149
Change-Id: I8088b8b0ba34f5c8349b71e1ac431751bd4f1b48

Change-Id: I44c36933437abf451e8efa0f9795a58aa62d8dd1
'}]
commit_message:
Add infrared plugin for OVN migration

This patch adds an ansible playbook and few roles to carry out
the OVN migration (from ml2ovs) as an infrared plugin. Although
the playbook can be used independently.

The goal is to make use of this in CI environments with
infrared/tripleo deployments to test the OVN migration.

Change-Id: I44c36933437abf451e8efa0f9795a58aa62d8dd1

subject: Continue running on_end() when instance deletion fails
messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-08-08 16:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-08-09 09:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks for the fix. Should go into the Rocky.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 16:35:19.000000000', 'message': "Continue running on_end() when instance deletion fails

A user can delete their instances while the on_end function is
executing. This can result in novaclient raising a NotFound exception,
preventing on_end() from completing successfully. The host allocations
are deleted at this point, but the hosts are left in the reservation's
aggregate, preventing future leases from starting.

This patch catches all exceptions and continues running on_end().

Change-Id: Ib495a26f9ec2e7eae64e1eaf69a6cf635c3aadcd
Closes-Bug: #1786073
"}]
commit_message:
Continue running on_end() when instance deletion fails

A user can delete their instances while the on_end function is
executing. This can result in novaclient raising a NotFound exception,
preventing on_end() from completing successfully. The host allocations
are deleted at this point, but the hosts are left in the reservation's
aggregate, preventing future leases from starting.

This patch catches all exceptions and continues running on_end().

Change-Id: Ib495a26f9ec2e7eae64e1eaf69a6cf635c3aadcd
Closes-Bug: #1786073

integration and remove the requirement.

commit_message:
add --include-trailing option to propose-library-branches

Add an option to let us include cycle-trailing libraries so it is
easier to do a final sweep and ensure that all libraries are branched.

Change-Id: Ibb9d4bc2173b106f6129a4e557807c13c0df559f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
only branch cycle-with-intermediary libraries automatically

At the end of Rocky we branched python-tripleoclient before the team
was ready because the script to prepare the list of branches did not
take the release model into account. Fix that.

Change-Id: I34c99f0d5c4a39f17b4de68558fc18fc10a7a706
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-08-08 06:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add ResellerAdmin role for ceph-rgw

ResellerAdmin role is used to give users object storage administration role
in their projects.

It is required to pass object storage quotas tests[1] of DefCore (OpenStack
Powered) certification test suite.

[1] tempest.api.object_storage.test_account_quotas*
Related-Bug: #1700729

Change-Id: Id976827aa7da271e54b77476f175f06bd1a00cc8
'}]
commit_message:
Add ResellerAdmin role for ceph-rgw

ResellerAdmin role is used to give users object storage administration role
in their projects.

It is required to pass object storage quotas tests[1] of DefCore (OpenStack
Powered) certification test suite.

[1] tempest.api.object_storage.test_account_quotas*
Related-Bug: #1700729

Change-Id: Id976827aa7da271e54b77476f175f06bd1a00cc8

notification.yaml for keystone authentication.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 09:38:59.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] HTTP test during update/upgrade/ffwd.

To mimic real life environment during update/upgrade/ffwd
 we'll expose a 'HTTP-live' test.
This test asserts that web server running in overcloud is
 reachable via its FIP and that content served is accessible.
Initial work done in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547220/

commit_message:
HTTP test during update/upgrade/ffwd.

To mimic real life environment during update/upgrade/ffwd
 we'll expose a 'HTTP-live' test.
This test asserts that web server running in overcloud is
 reachable via its FIP and that content served is accessible.
Initial work done in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547220/

Co-Authored-By: Marius Cornea <mcornea@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifb3970a0fadb9516bd1ae7ec8cae5a43d49ee720

commit_message:
Remove -u root as mysql is executed with root user

As openstack installation guides suggest to run mysql with root shell
user, mysql will not ask for password, so in
controller-install-*.rst "-u root -p" is useless.

Change-Id: Ib209661f6dcbbdeb158bd1acf343c084f8ed8930
Closes-Bug: #1785025

[{'created': '2018-08-07 19:15:08.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly call is_distributed_router()

A recent change to _notify_l3_agent_port_update() was
making a call to is_distributed_router() via the l3plugin,
but since that method lives in l3_dvr_db.py it was
failing.  This was not caught by the unit test since it
was mocking the return value.

Had to modify things to get the router first since the

Change-Id: I2289f882b692b375d1b40d7a50d206d72da66155
Closes-bug: #1785848

but since that method lives in l3_dvr_db.py it was
failing.  This was not caught by the unit test since it

Had to modify things to get the router first since the

Change-Id: I2289f882b692b375d1b40d7a50d206d72da66155

commit_message:
Correctly call is_distributed_router()

A recent change to _notify_l3_agent_port_update() was
making a call to is_distributed_router() via the l3plugin,
but since that method lives in l3_dvr_db.py it was
failing.  This was not caught by the unit test since it
was mocking the return value.

Had to modify things to get the router first since the
object is required for the check.

Change-Id: I2289f882b692b375d1b40d7a50d206d72da66155
Closes-bug: #1785848

commit_message:
Make fluorine functional voting

The test seem to be stable and it's the current ODL version.

This patch enables the functional tests.

Change-Id: I194bdcdf0de4b60aaf1318ce4119642eda1f2ef9

commit_message:
Adding resources callback handler for FWaaS v2 logging

This patch allows logging plugin to trigger logging driver in event of
receiving callback events AFTER_UPDATE/AFTER_CREATE/AFTER_DELETE from
firewall group resources.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I4e529273fe978d52e8948b844880a48f342fbd8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-02 09:37:20.000000000', 'message': 'WIP [log]: Add rpc stuff for logging

This patch adds rpc stuff for logging extension as below:
- Reserves a rpc notification api for log drivers if a log driver
requires rpc.
- Reserves a rpc listener for listening callback from log drivers.
- Also provides db_api: get_logs_bound_port, get_logs_bound_fwg,
get_fwg_log_info_for_port and get_fwg_log_info_for_log_resources.

Change-Id: I6ad3fcec9a233286fdbd039d6d0e3a842c027f3f

commit_message:
[log]: Add rpc stuff for logging

This patch adds rpc stuff for logging extension as below:
- Reserves a rpc listener for listening callback from log drivers.
- Also provides log_db_api:
        + get_logs_bound_port
        + get_logs_bound_fwg
        + get_fwg_log_info_for_port
        + get_fwg_log_info_for_log_resources
This patch also introduces get_fwg_ports_in_tenant method in
firewall_db_v2.py as helper function for further processing.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kim Bao Long <longkb@vn.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I6ad3fcec9a233286fdbd039d6d0e3a842c027f3f

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3a9cec0b79c14a535a60017daafcadc187836bcd

subject: Enable keystone authentication with webhook notification
messages:
[{'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-20 10:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-07-30 15:10:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Akhil, thanks for this. Looks quite good after the first glance.

In Monasca we track feature requests in StoryBoard. I've created a Story for you [1]. Feel free to update the content and please add the reference in the commit message in the form:

  Story: 2003105
  Task: 23220

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003105

Alternatively, we could add a high level Congress-Monasca-Tacker integration scenario description in Self-Healing SIG [2] and track the progress there. That would add visibility to the effort.

[2] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/917

Have you though about adding support for Keystone Trusts [3, 4]? The implementation in Aodh seems to be quite straight forward [5]. They use username part of the notification address as the trust ID. We could make it optional depending on the address string.

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/queens/admin/identity-use-trusts.html
[4] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3-ext/index.html#os-trust-api
[5] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/aodh/tree/aodh/notifier/trust.py"}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-31 15:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-31 15:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Witold, Thanks for review. I have added Story and Task as you have suggested. Also one comment inline. Other things I need to go through first.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-31 21:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Makes sense to me overall! Listening in on the continuing discussion.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-08-07 08:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-08-07 09:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Witold, thanks for detailed reviews.
I have done changed as you have commented.
Also about keystone trust we can work in different commit and need some detailed discussion with you for that, mainly how to get trustor/trustee userId, role_id and project_id. I mean the approach to follow to access these details from current framework.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-08-07 11:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks, tested and works. Minor comments inline.

About Trusts, the PTG next month would be a great opportunity to discuss that. Will someone from your team attend?'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes it would be great to discuss in PTG but its not planned yet. Maybe Ghanshyam Mann will be there, he might not have enough time. I will discuss anyway and let you know any progress on this.

Also few comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-08-07 13:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Enable keystone authentication with webhook notification

This commit adds functionality of sending webhook notifications to
various projects that require keystone authentications. For which user
need to set auth credentials in conf under keystone header.
By default it is disabled, which can be enabled in conf.

Change-Id: I3e773af8c3ebe0cf1d57e8fa1351b1e725a9cfa0
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-monasca-push-driver
Story: 2003105
Task: 23220

[{'created': '2018-08-08 17:54:47.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic1a5718ecabee7391971671d4d292ad2e0e4d391
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic1a5718ecabee7391971671d4d292ad2e0e4d391

[{'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-01-11 10:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-01-15 04:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Cuong,

Thanks for your great work on fwaas logging.

Regarding to validate for firewall group logging, I think we can consider use cases:
 - if target_id is specified in a log request, we should check whether vm port id or router port id exists or not.
 - if resource_id is specified in a log request, we should check whether firewall group exists or not.
 - if both of resource_id and target_id are specified in a log request, we should check constraint between target_id and resource_id.
- Do we need to consider whether log_driver support firewall group type for port or router? For vm port, we have to consider about that. For router port i'm not sure. 
 

Is there miss registering 'validate_firewall_group_request' method to VALIDATE_METHOD_MAP?"}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-01-16 10:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-01-16 10:28:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi An,

Thanks for your suggestions, I've addressed them in new ps. Can you help to review?

> Is there miss registering 'validate_firewall_group_request' method to VALIDATE_METHOD_MAP?

I think the registration will be used on driver side, correct?"}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-01-16 12:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Cuong,

> I think the registration will be used on driver side, correct?

commit_message:
Add log validator for FWaaS v2 logging

This patch adds a method to validate logging request for FWaaS.
It also introduces get_fwg_attached_to_port method in db_v2 as
helper function for logging feature.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kim Bao Long <longkb@vn.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I723b48a75ba3f19476785bec0c5d5295d04aac95

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trbski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 16222, 'name': 'witek', 'email': 'witold.bedyk@suse.com', 'username': 'witek'}, {'_account_id': 20033, 'name': 'Artur Basiak', 'email': 'artur.basiak@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'abasiak'}, {'_account_id': 25231, 'name': 'Nathan Oyler', 'email': 'notque@gmail.com', 'username': 'notq'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16982, 'date': '2016-12-08 14:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-08 15:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-monasca-agent-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/408653/1/check/gate-monasca-agent-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/1ae11da/ : SUCCESS in 1m 49s
- gate-monasca-agent-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/408653/1/check/gate-monasca-agent-python27-ubuntu-xenial/5263979/ : SUCCESS in 2m 36s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-monasca-python-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/53/408653/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-monasca-python-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6154fe6/ : SUCCESS in 30m 42s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-monasca-java-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/53/408653/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-monasca-java-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/c07ddfa/ : SUCCESS in 32m 37s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2016-12-21 09:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

we use this in production since quite a while'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-01-09 21:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tests ?'}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2017-01-11 10:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

tests - we would like to have them, but it does not make sense for us anymore since  we have no plans for further extensions.'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-01-11 10:47:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> tests - we would like to have them, but it does not make sense for
 > us anymore since  we have no plans for further extensions.

So, I don't follow, but you still want to have this merged, right ? 

BTW: I'd like see that agent's coverage. That's one side to add missing ones which is kind of difficult but there again this code is new and tests were just out of the scope since beginning. I am not okay with that, that's my opinion of course, other guys were added to this review. Other CR and Roland should give their opinion about this part."}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2017-01-11 11:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

we needed a solution urgently and for that reason skipped test automation in the beginning. Later on we found the thing to work, so the motivation to add tests was small. Everybody knows this song ... IMHO it is not about being ok or not ok.

We believe the plugin is a good addition to the agent. But we would also understand when you, the Monasca core team, decides that tests should be mandatory without exception. I wonder whether it would make sense to have a place for plugins that should not be shipped with the agent by default.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-01-20 20:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

-1 for the metric naming

How long does it take this plugin to run? It seems to make a lot of command line calls'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-02-01 06:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any further progress on this one ?'}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2017-02-01 11:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am taking over from Falk now. To answer you question about runtimes. We have 7 calls to external commands, each of them < 200ms on our systems.

@Craig: you mentioned naming conventions for metrics. Actually I was looking for such conventions when I worked on other plugins but did not find much. After looking at the metrics that are available from other plugins, I have no clear picture.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-02-01 16:18:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Joachim, naming is inconsistent since some of the plugins were inherited from DataDog but all new plugins should follow the rules that I gave you.'}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2017-02-02 09:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

@Craig: Would you mind documenting them as well in https://github.com/openstack/monasca-agent/blob/master/docs/MonascaMetrics.md#metric-names? That would make things easier. Got your point and will try to update the names accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-02-03 21:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Joachim, Yes, I will try to get that done soon. Good idea'}, {'account_id': 20033, 'date': '2017-05-26 12:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

any news on this change?'}, {'account_id': 17244, 'date': '2018-02-07 08:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Joachim Barheine with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Joachim Barheine <joachim.barheine@sap.com>
'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-08-08 23:48:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh I didn't realise this swift recon check patch had been pushed, I pushed one up about a month ago (583876).

The Swift recon is a REST API, so rather then wrapping the binary which will then go query _each_ storage node, wouldn't it be better to hit the API of the node this agent is sitting on, and report it's recon metrics back? That'll mean less recon traffic across the cluster.
If an agent is on every swift storage node, then each storage node is potentially talking to each other storage node for similar metrics (calling swift-recon). The swift-recon tool also tends to only report the first, last and average. If you hit the API directly you get all metrics and can do what you want with it.

That's how my version works anyway. For me this came up as SUSE hackweek project and as a Swift Core I didn't see much useful recon metrics in monasca. I'm sorry I didn't do a better search through gerrit, my bad. I should have collaborated on this patch instead."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-08-09 08:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Matthew, SAP does not work on the project any more. We should review your patch and abandon this one afterwards.

What you could use from here are the naming conventions for metrics and dimensions.'}]

commit_message:
Swift Recon Agent plugin

This will agent plugin uses swift-recon tool to collect important
metrics from the swift cluster like: storage capacity and
failed drives (for complete list see docs/Plugins.md)
Detection will install the plugin on all nodes with a running
swift-proxy process.

Change-Id: I704f675b04d10f4a85c68207257bae1738b585e1

To summarize on the changes, you would prefer --embed-certs which will trigger the embedding of the certs in the config file, is this it? Default false as in kubernetes? And always writing the certificate files as before?

The flag i was adding was to manage the output of the certs in separate files, while always embedding them in the config. So an alternative would be to call the flag --output-certs, default to True to mimic the current behavior, and always embed?'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> To summarize on the changes, you would prefer --embed-certs which
 > will trigger the embedding of the certs in the config file, is this
 > it? 

To hopefully be more clear, I think these are the situations in mind:

1) if user does not use --embed-certs then automatically --output-certs (current behavior)
2) if  user does not use --embed-certs and --output-certs specified (same result as above) (current behavior)
3) if --embed-certs and not --output-certs, only provide embedded 
4) if --embed-certs and --output-certs requested then embed them and output files'}, {'account_id': 9995, 'date': '2018-07-23 11:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9995, 'date': '2018-07-23 11:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > To summarize on the changes, you would prefer --embed-certs which

 > 1) if user does not use --embed-certs then automatically
 > --output-certs (current behavior)
 > 2) if  user does not use --embed-certs and --output-certs specified
 > (same result as above) (current behavior)
 > 3) if --embed-certs and not --output-certs, only provide embedded
 > 4) if --embed-certs and --output-certs requested then embed them
 > and output files

This sounds good, but I chose a slightly different logic to simplify the default options. Let me know what you think.

What we would like is for users to get (by default) embed certs without having to pass extra options, and no output certs to not pollute the local dirs. I pushed a change with options:

--output-certs (boolean, store_true, default false)
--no-embed-certs (boolean, store_true, default false)

So:
* openstack coe cluster config <cluster> : gives embed, no output certs
* openstack coe cluster config --output-certs <cluster> : same, but giving extra output files
* openstack coe cluster config --no-embed-certs <cluster> : if for some reason users would want a config without embed certs


The only thing is to add in the release notes that the default behavior changes as by default there will be no output cert files. I think this is worth it though, the default is much better without the files.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
[k8s] Add embed certs to config

Add embed certs to kubernetes config file to cluster config

Add option --output-certs to cluster config enabling the output of the
certificates files (ca, key, cert). This is for compatibility with tools
that require the certificates in separate files.

Change-Id: I595d243bc9f30d813af06aad46a9037afe383ab5
Story: 1774643
Task: 21668

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 21:08:07.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib8ace447c77f1029ad6c979cc12bf9a26a9a1e97
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib8ace447c77f1029ad6c979cc12bf9a26a9a1e97

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

commit_message:
Remove dup config on tripleo-ci jobs

- fs037 has dup config as pre-run, required-projects and
files filtering.
- pre-run and required-projects are already set in the base
parent job 'tripleo-ci-base'.
- pre-run is being called twice (from the top leaf job and from
its parent).
- post-run is common to all jobs that parents to tripleo-ci-base,
move it to the parent.

Change-Id: I0bc6a7f0422caf0b4b8c813510025490c0a2a087
Closes-Bug: #1785288

commit_message:
Uses new format for CephX keys caps

Updates the format of the CephX keys caps to a new one which
does not need backward compatibility in ceph-ansible

Change-Id: Icd36ac32ec0ed708e66fe638bcbf54cee2d1ae69
(cherry picked from commit c0fc85f306dc0e8fa1aaaf8cf2536ab879181cb5)

Or is it complements it and we may want to see a separate prep scripts for overcloud vs undercloud?'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-05-17 09:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So this topic to address https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1691467 RFE'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-05-19 09:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 09:48:01.000000000', 'message': 'Unify custom t-h-t install steps for UC/OC/upgrade

Allow undercloud installations from custom t-h-t, similarly to
overcloud_templates_* logic.

Unify and share custom t-h-t install steps for over/under
cloud and upgrades cases via tasks imported from overcloud-prep-config.

Change the overcloud_templates_path to use the working dir instead of
hacking into /usr/share, which might break the installed t-h-t package
and corrupt the (upgrade_)composable_scenario logic, when copying missing
tht files from the RPM dir into the given templates path.

Add commons dependency for undercloud-deploy to get the shared defaults,
like overcloud_templates_path.

To diverge (mixed or not) undercloud from overcloud update/upgrade cases,
use the following shared mappings (vars on the right correspond to UC cases
and do nothing yet, but only disable the code blocks under its control):

  composable_scenario:  undercloud_composable_scenario
  upgrade_composable_scenario: undercloud_upgrade_composable_scenario
  prep_post_hook_script: undercloud_prep_post_hook_script
  download_templates_rpm: download_undercloud_templates_rpm
  tht_rpm_url: undercloud_tht_rpm_url

Those are left for future use in UC update/upgrade/mixed cases.
And for overclouds update/upgrade cases:

  composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  upgrade_composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  prep_post_hook_script: overcloud_prep_post_hook_script
  download_templates_rpm: download_overcloud_templates_rpm
  tht_rpm_url: remains unchanged

TODO converge shared OC/UC prep scripts and templates into a new
prep-configs role to make it more generic.

TODO now that we have overcloud_templates_path defaults altered from
/usr/share/.. to the working dir, figure out what to do with
/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates hardocded in:

  * roles/overcloud-upgrade,
  * roles/overcloud-ssl,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/config-download.yaml.j2,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/deployed_server_prepare.sh.j2.

Shall those paths be retained as is, assuming the t-h-t from the
installed RPM dir, or also reworked to the
undercloud/overcloud_templates_path, assuming the git cloned and
checked out t-h-t?

Related-bug: #1691467
Closes-bug: #1781227
Change-Id: I4e0dcf24b93b8e4afb8359cb5108c4b7b5ba3d55
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 11:41:19.000000000', 'message': "Unify custom t-h-t install steps for UC/OC/upgrade

Allow undercloud installations/upgrades from custom t-h-t, similarly to
overcloud_templates_* et al.

Unify and share custom t-h-t install script for OC and UC and mixed
update/upgrade cases via new shared role tht-prep-config.

Change the overcloud_templates_path to use the working dir instead of
hacking into /usr/share. Changing the RPM dir breaks the installed t-h-t
package and might corrupt the (upgrade_)composable_scenario logic, when
copying missing files from the RPM dir into the working dir.

To diverge undercloud from overcloud install/update/upgrade cases,
use the following shared mappings (vars on the right correspond to UC cases):

  * tht_templates_path: undercloud_templates_path
  * tht_templates_repo: undercloud_templates_repo
  * tht_templates_branch: undercloud_templates_branch
  * tht_templates_refspec: undercloud_templates_refspec

and a 2nd group (defaults set to do nothing, but only disable the script's code
blocks under control of those):

  * composable_scenario:  undercloud_composable_scenario
  * upgrade_composable_scenario: undercloud_upgrade_composable_scenario
  * prep_post_hook_script: undercloud_prep_post_hook_script
  * download_templates_rpm: download_undercloud_templates_rpm
  * tht_rpm_url: undercloud_tht_rpm_url

Those in group 2 may be customized to mimic the overcloud mixed upgrades logic
for underclouds/all-in-one.

And for overclouds respectively, use mappings:

  composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  upgrade_composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  prep_post_hook_script: overcloud_prep_post_hook_script
  download_templates_rpm: download_overcloud_templates_rpm
  tht_rpm_url: remains unchanged
  tht_templates_path: overcloud_templates_path
  ...

TODO now that we have overcloud_templates_path defaults altered from
/usr/share/.. to the working dir, figure out what to do with
/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates hardocded in:

  * roles/overcloud-upgrade,
  * roles/overcloud-ssl,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/config-download.yaml.j2,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/deployed_server_prepare.sh.j2.

Shall those paths be retained as is, assuming the t-h-t from the
installed RPM dir, or also reworked to the
undercloud/overcloud_templates_path, assuming the git cloned and
checked out t-h-t?

Related-bug: #1691467
Closes-bug: #1781227
Change-Id: I4e0dcf24b93b8e4afb8359cb5108c4b7b5ba3d55
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

overcloud_templates_* et al.

update/upgrade cases via new shared role tht-prep-config.

To diverge undercloud from overcloud install/update/upgrade cases,
use the following shared mappings (vars on the right correspond to UC cases):

  * tht_templates_path: undercloud_templates_path
  * tht_templates_repo: undercloud_templates_repo
  * tht_templates_branch: undercloud_templates_branch
  * tht_templates_refspec: undercloud_templates_refspec

and a 2nd group (defaults set to do nothing, but only disable the script's code
blocks under control of those):

  * composable_scenario:  undercloud_composable_scenario
  * upgrade_composable_scenario: undercloud_upgrade_composable_scenario
  * prep_post_hook_script: undercloud_prep_post_hook_script
  * download_templates_rpm: download_undercloud_templates_rpm
  * tht_rpm_url: undercloud_tht_rpm_url

Those in group 2 may be customized to mimic the overcloud mixed upgrades logic
for underclouds/all-in-one.

And for overclouds respectively, use mappings:

  composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  upgrade_composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  prep_post_hook_script: overcloud_prep_post_hook_script
  download_templates_rpm: download_overcloud_templates_rpm
  tht_rpm_url: remains unchanged
  tht_templates_path: overcloud_templates_path
  ...

TODO now that we have overcloud_templates_path defaults altered from
/usr/share/.. to the working dir, figure out what to do with
/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates hardocded in:

  * roles/overcloud-upgrade,
  * roles/overcloud-ssl,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/config-download.yaml.j2,
  * roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/deployed_server_prepare.sh.j2.

Shall those paths be retained as is, assuming the t-h-t from the
installed RPM dir, or also reworked to the
undercloud/overcloud_templates_path, assuming the git cloned and
checked out t-h-t?

TODO(maybe) change the overcloud_templates_path to use the working dir
instead of hacking into /usr/share. Changing the RPM dir breaks the
installed t-h-t package and might corrupt the (upgrade_)composable_scenario
logic, when copying missing files from the RPM dir into the working dir.

Related-bug: #1691467
Closes-bug: #1781227
Change-Id: I4e0dcf24b93b8e4afb8359cb5108c4b7b5ba3d55
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

  * upgrade_composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  * prep_post_hook_script: overcloud_prep_post_hook_script
  * download_templates_rpm: download_overcloud_templates_rpm
  * tht_rpm_url: remains unchanged
  * tht_templates_path: overcloud_templates_path
  ...

Related-bug: #1691467
Closes-bug: #1781227
Change-Id: I4e0dcf24b93b8e4afb8359cb5108c4b7b5ba3d55
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Unify custom t-h-t install steps for UC/OC/upgrade

Allow undercloud installations/upgrades from custom t-h-t, similarly to
overcloud_templates_* et al.

Unify and share custom t-h-t install script for OC and UC and mixed
update/upgrade cases via new shared role tht-prep-config.

To diverge undercloud from overcloud install/update/upgrade cases, use
the following shared mappings (vars on the right correspond to UC
cases):

  * tht_templates_path: undercloud_templates_path (defaults to RPM dir)
  * tht_templates_repo: undercloud_templates_repo
  * tht_templates_branch: undercloud_templates_branch
  * tht_templates_refspec: undercloud_templates_refspec

and a 2nd group (defaults set to do nothing, but only disable the
t-h-t prepare script's code blocks under control of those):

  * composable_scenario:  undercloud_composable_scenario
  * upgrade_composable_scenario: undercloud_upgrade_composable_scenario
  * prep_post_hook_script: undercloud_prep_post_hook_script
  * download_templates_rpm: download_undercloud_templates_rpm
  * tht_rpm_url: undercloud_tht_rpm_url

Those in group 2 may be customized to mimic the overcloud mixed
upgrades logic for underclouds/all-in-one for future use.

And for overclouds respectively, use mappings:

  * composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  * upgrade_composable_scenario: remains unchanged
  * prep_post_hook_script: overcloud_prep_post_hook_script
  * download_templates_rpm: download_overcloud_templates_rpm
  * tht_rpm_url: remains unchanged
  * tht_templates_path: overcloud_templates_path
  ...

Related-bug: #1691467
Closes-bug: #1781227
Change-Id: I4e0dcf24b93b8e4afb8359cb5108c4b7b5ba3d55
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

So my point of view is that the real issue is[1].  We define a release specific parameter (containerized_overcloud) inside the feature set, which in this p->o is not a valid assumption.

commit_message:
Configure the containerized_overcloud variable in ocata upgrade

If we use ocata, we can't deploy the overcloud using containers.

Change-Id: I83ce31cd9f919704b03abce71aab56fb46337b74
Closes-Bug: 1786016

commit_message:
Support for chinese name to show

I create a project with a chinese name, then get the project
with the name. The identity API version is default to 2.0.

openstack --debug project show 
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystoneclient/base.py:283:
UnicodeWarning: Unicode equal comparison failed to convert both
arguments to Unicode - interpreting them as being unequal
  for (attr, value) in searches):
No tenant with a name or ID of '' exists.

Closes-Bug: #1710329
Change-Id: I32041760c1da226406fea08fc25c57658de89eb7
